description: When resizing disk partitions using the diskpart tool, there is a risk of inadvertently jeopardizing the functionality of the system. This symptom suggests that improper management or execution of disk resizing tasks can potentially lead to system instability or even data loss. The observation is noted in context with KB-5028997, which outlines procedures for partition management but implicitly points to the dangers involved if not performed carefully. Administrators must be cautious as miscalculations or mistakes in partition resizing may put critical system operations at risk. In essence, while the tool can be effective, it also carries significant responsibilities.
